attributes.action: Make it illegal for rail fares to rise without inflation and improved services
attributes.background: Every year the public has to pay more to travel on a train network that is not contributing back to the paying customers who along with businesses rely on the efficient running of the railway, delays cancellations and strikes are increasing in number and action needs to be taken rapidly.

attributes.action: Introduce rent caps on private let & prevent landlords refusing Housing Benefit
attributes.background: Currently in the SE private rents have become ridiculous, with  a single room costing as much as £700 pm. This is useless to a largely working class area. To add to this most letting agents and landlords refuse to accept any form of housing benefit, even as a top up.
attributes.additional_details: I would as that we stop the practice of refusing to accept tenants with housing benefit and ask that we put caps on how much rent can be charged. £1400 pm for a house is impossibly high! This requires you to be earning £34,000 and pay almost £3000 up front (figures on a recent viewing of a property) The average UK wage of £26,500 would not cover this. We have houses. People simply cannot afford them! I would also ask they they stop houses being split into rooms for rental reducing family homes.

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: Owners of UK newspapers must be British citizens
attributes.background: Newspapers have enormous influence in UK politics, but the biggest of them are not owned by British citizens. They have power without being real stakeholders in society.  Those seeking to influence UK politics and opinion should actually be citizens who will have to live with the results.

attributes.action: To lower the legal driving age to16 in the UK
attributes.background: I would like to lower the legal driving age to 16 as at this age you can take on many adult responsibilities such as paying tax, join the army, leave home, pay adult tickets on public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Australian process of learning to drive is three fold where learners are required to log their driving experience throughout the learning. Young adults must display the relevant 'P' plates to show the stages of learning they are at such as Red P plates to green P plates to full license.

attributes.action: Rethink the way dla assess babies born and affected by talipes (clubfoot)
attributes.background: My son was born in 2011 with talipes( clubfoot in 1 of his feet) it was turned inwards. From 3 days old he had a full leg cast on, every week we went a 102 mile round trip to see his consultant, At 3 months his tendon cut and then he wore ponsetti boots and bar -firstly for 23hrs a day then 12hrs.
attributes.additional_details: He couldnt kick his legs freely, he couldnt roll over in his bed to get comfortable. He was stuck on his back thumping a metal bar with his little blue boots attached. Some people get dla as the assessor see it requires 'more care' than a normal baby, but like myself we didnt.My son did require more care, and as he got older with the boots on it got harder on him and myself. Dla needs to address this and make a serious decision to if all should get it or none.They are born with this abnormality

attributes.action: more funding for paediatric cardiac teaching more complex /rare heart conditions
attributes.background: My daughter aged 6months died in hospital due to post op complications. She had ebsteins anomaly a rare heart condition.  Doctors in the UK don't know much about this condition and struggle to help fix/ and or treat accordingly.

attributes.action: stop animal cruelty and any type of testing on animals
attributes.background: i think that there are many other ways to test and experiment with different products in a completely cruelty free way, the UK is part of the chain of the biggest animal cruelty users in the world for no apparent reason. Research will show you scientific ways to test out products without animal use.
attributes.additional_details: PETA is a strong animal cruelty free organisation that fight for the animals rights to their own freedom, not including harmful experiments. I also think that people of the public need to be more educated on this controversial topic to understand what actually happens when making their products that they use every single day.

attributes.action: Ban the taking of photographs of children in school without the child's consent
attributes.background: The concept of private life is a broad one which encompasses the right to identity.  A pupil's image reveals his or her unique characteristics and constitutes one of the chief attributes of his or her personality.
attributes.additional_details: A child, over the age of 12, must be able to give or withdraw consent to the taking of his or her images in addition to the wishes and feelings of the parents/legal guardians.  At present, there are guidelines published by the Information Commissioners Office as to the taking of photographs at schools.  We argue that this is not sufficient because the use of personal mobile phones within a class room setting by a tutor is not prohibited.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Blue Badge support for injuries causing short term paralysis and disabilities.
attributes.background: Following an injury or during recovery from surgery you may have limited mobility and so need some of the help a Blue Badge offers like access to disabled parking.  Currently anyone anyone with "temporary" conditions like this do not qualify.  A short term badge should be introduced.
attributes.additional_details: Follow an accident my leg was badly broken. The doctors were able to save my leg but I now have a frame holding it together.  I was rejected for a blue badge as i was told I could walk 100 meters on crutches. I had to appeal explaining that the frame was no guarantee I would recover and without it I would not be able to walk at all plus it's very painful. While in this condition I need access to disabled parking so I can open the car door fully when getting in and out.

attributes.action: Prioritise the building of new social housing to help solve the housing crisis.
attributes.background: Many people in their 20's, 30's and 40's are forced to live in private rental accommodation that is costing them a fortune and that in some cases is not fit for purpose. They are also being forced out of the areas they grew up in due to the high cost of housing.
attributes.additional_details: By building more social housing with affordable rents, prioritised for local people, areas can retain there unique cultures. This will also reduce rents for private tenants as demand is reduced, due to people having social housing available. In the longer term, house prices will then reduce as demand from landlords for properties they can rent out is reduced as they get less return on their investment. Private builders cant solve the crisis but councils can with social housing.

attributes.action: Make MP's expenses payable from their political party funds and not the taxpayer
attributes.background:
The people of the UK hear about cuts to public services they rely on but also about the financial slight of hand performed with MP's expenses.
Take this burden off the public purse.
Call it an austerity measure.
attributes.additional_details: Assuming approximately £100,000 of expenses per MP that saves over £60 million per year that could be spent elsewhere for the benefit of the people.

attributes.action: Compulsory jail sentences for the possession of pornographic images of children
attributes.background: I can imagine everyone with young children in their lives would do anything and everything to protect them, just as I would my young brothers. However, the leniency and attitude criminal courts have began to display towards those who exploit our children for their own sexual thrill has disturbed me.
attributes.additional_details: I am calling for all those, with/without a record or pleads/is found guilty of possessing indecent images, to be sent to jail. Regardless of displayed remorse, paedophiles are becoming more and more of a problem. With the digital age modernising the world at an immense pace, paedophiles will find it easier to anonymise themselves - when, the truth is, they need punishment and rehabilitation.

attributes.action: Stop using the term "benefit" when referring to the state pension.
attributes.background: Calling the state pension a "benefit" is offensive. Civil servants and MPs refer to the state pension under this heading but it does not reflect the tax and NI paid, and the years of working required to qualify. Furthermore it demeans pensioners and undermines dignity in old age.

attributes.action: Defend a child's right to equality of education for 2year olds
attributes.background:
Petition for equal rights for ALL children's education, regardless of financial background.

A 2year old can now start education in public schools, government funded. But only qualify if the family receives benefits.

Working families are asked to pay for this service.
attributes.additional_details:
How is this fair that children from working class backgrounds are suffering and missing on education because of funding. I simply cannot afford this service because I work. This needs to change. My child is missing out on education because I chose to provide for my family morally.

Petition for equal rights for ALL children regardless of families financial background.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and distribution of single-use plastic drinks bottles in the UK
attributes.background: Billions of single-use plastic drinks bottles are sold each year in the UK. Too many of these end up on our beaches and in our oceans, where they harm marine and bird life life. This can be avoided by using less damaging alternatives such as aluminium cans, cardboard cartons and glass.

attributes.action: Change the law for dog on dog attacks.
attributes.background:
Whilst out walking a friends dog in April 2016 he was attacked whilst on a lead, on a playing field by two other dogs and killed. 
The owner of the two dogs had previously had her dogs on leads and muzzled but took them off so she could play ball with them.
attributes.additional_details: We propose that dog on dog attacks are taken seriously and legislation introduced to convict irresponsible owners whose dogs have attacked those of innocent families and ensure they are held accountable legally for their actions.

attributes.action: Make children and young people in care's funding go up to the age of 21!
attributes.background: People who have been through the care system will understand....The need for support at 18 years old but none being accessible because there is no funding. We need to fight to change this!

attributes.action: Offer U.K. citizenship to all E.U. citizens with permanent residence status
attributes.background:
There are many eu citizens who have built a life for themselves in this country over many years. Their children may have been educated here, they may bought property or married u.k. citizens,.
as things stand despite all they have contributed they face an uncertain future. They deserve security

attributes.action: Suspend hospital fines for breaches in 4h waits in Emergency Departments
attributes.background: The Standard Contract for NHS Providers in 2015-16 charges hospitals £120 for every breach of the 4h wait times over the target in Emergency Departments. With unprecedented pressure on Emergency Departments currently this is an absurd system of punishing hospitals for being busy.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Health Committee "Winter pressure in accident and emergency departments Third Report of Session 2016–17" demonstrates that compliance with 4h targets plummets every winter (85% in 2015, 80% in 2016) and demand is currently higher than ever. Hospitals are paying the price of chronic government underfunding of Primary Care and Community Care, and to financially penalise hospitals for flawed government policy is clearly absurd.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Service to calculate payments based on annual basic net pay.
attributes.background: Calculations shouldn't include overtime, shift allowances nor any bonuses.
attributes.additional_details: Receiving parents to provide evidence of what they spend child maintenance on

attributes.action: Stop Govia Thameslink( GTR) from being allowed to increase fares in 2017
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink the owners of Southern Rail have consistently failed to provide a service which could be considered acceptable in any reasonable way. 
With both individuals and businesses losing millions they should not be allowed to raise fares when they are not providing a proper service.
attributes.additional_details:
With well documented proof that they have consistently failed to provide a proper service, have left passengers stranded and have cost individuals & businesses millions in lost revenue collectively the owners of Southern Rail should have no automatic right to increase fares when they have failed miserably to provide an acceptable service for the last 8 months of 2016. 

This issue has been raised in the house several times and is public knowledge.

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.

attributes.action: Initiate a Parliamentary Inquiry into the UK Insurance Industry
attributes.background:
The UK Insurance Industry operates under practices which are in direct contrast to the interests of its customers.
Involving multiple entities in any single claim increases costs which are passed on to the policy holder's insurer.  
Cases are settled to avoid costs in spite of no fault situations
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/money/blog/2012/sep/14/insurance-companies-defraud-us

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/money/insurance/article4632734.ece

http://www.mindfulmoney.co.uk/mindful-news/an-end-to-auto-renewals-insurers-forced-to-provide-premium-comparison/

http://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/10/the-car-insurance-industry-is-a-disgusting-racket/

http://www.emeraldinsight.com/doi/abs/10.1016/S1529-2096%2806%2907002-7

http://uk.practicallaw.com/2-200-4590?q=&qp=&qo=&qe=

attributes.action: Make Politics a mandatory subject for the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: Elections in the US and the recent Brexit vote demonstrate key decisions that the people need to have a good background in Politics to vote on. Giving an education promotes this exploration of politics earlier than just 6 months before a referendum/election. Students can make up their own mind.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-1.png

http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-2.png

People need the chance to have an educated vote, not voting on personality or party without understanding.

attributes.action: Ban the use of zoos as a tourist attraction
attributes.background: Zoos set a limit on animal freedom, it is wrong that just because we are the dominant and most forward thinking species that we should capture and restraint the freedom of other animals for our own entertainment. I am petitioning to end animal captivity and give every animal the freedom it deserves.
attributes.additional_details: The world is developing at an extremely fast rate and traditions are not the only things fading out. It is estimated that 99% of all species that have lived on earth are now extinct, and over 150,000 become extinct every day. these animals have limited lives as it is, and it isn't right for us as a dominant and prosperous species to constrain the animals to a restricted life in a cage.

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: Once the UK is not bound by EU legislation remove the 20% VAT on e-literature
attributes.background:
Ebooks and paid e-literature  (electronic newspaper/magazine subscriptions) carry 20% VAT but paper books, newspapers and magazines are zero rated for VAT. 
In the past we have been told that EU legislation prevents a 0% VAT rate and that e-literature is a 'service'.
attributes.additional_details:
After BREXIT the UK will set VAT rates on this. 

Claiming e-formats are a service but paper is not is ridiculous since both formats require:
an author
an editor
formatting
Only paper requires tree felling, transport, manufacture, printing, storage, eventual disposal. Re-pulped books require de-inking & disposal of toxic waste.

e-formats need little oil, produce little toxic waste & add almost nothing to carbon emissions.

The government should encourage e-formats by removing this bizarre VAT.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fortification of milk and other foodstuffs with Vitamin D.
attributes.background:
Finding tasty foods that are high in Vitamin D is a challenging task.

The majority of the UK population suffers from Vitamin D deficiencies. 
Government must act to prevent the continuing rise in bone diseases such as rickets through mandatory Vitamin D food fortification, as in USA and Canada.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the BBC "Vitamin D deficiency is likely to affect over half the UK's white population, up to 90% of the multi-ethnic population and a quarter of all children living in Britain."

The British Medical Journal recently published a journal saying fortifying foods with Vitamin D (adding Vitamin D to food) would reduce the risk of illness and improve bone and muscle health.

The SACN has also urged an increase in the RDA of Vitamin D to 10 µg/day (400 IU/d), throughout the year.

attributes.action: Prevent the UK defence from becoming useless, fulfil the NATO pledge of 2%
attributes.background: To be spending less than 2 per cent of GDP on defence is utterly unacceptable, particularly in this time of immense global uncertainty.
attributes.additional_details: The IISS said Britain’s defence spending had dipped below the NATO benchmark figure, despite the government vowing to meet the target. However has continued its campaign of unnecessary cuts to defence by selling of well-established bases weakening the defence of the nation. This is a great error in judgement as fails generations of hard work in building our defence to be the best it can be in the modern era.

attributes.action: reinstate b+e entitlement on all driving licences after 1st Jan 1997.
attributes.background:
Allow drivers since 1st January 1997 to be able legally tow a trailer upto 3500kg.
Current legislation is costly to the user and stops the independence of many hobbies.

attributes.action: Raise £9 billion a year to fund the disastrous shortfall in the NHS
attributes.background:
The Kings Fund predicts an £8 billion a year shortfall to NHS funding by 2020/21. No government wants to deal with this deficit by raising income tax. 

A 2p in the pound rise in income tax would raise approx £9 billion a year.
This money could be 'ringfenced' for sole use by the NHS

attributes.action: We would like to get Creative Writing reinstated as an A- Level qualification
attributes.background: In 2018, the last exams of A-Level Creative Writing will run. This is  because the Department of Education and OFQUAL say that it doesn't meet their guidance and Nicky Morgan and Gove argue that it is not 'Academic' enough. We want to show them how academic it really is and show them why it matters.
attributes.additional_details: We want to argue against this. Michael Rosen said How about cutting art from art?. The government says that Creative Writing is too vocational yet they don't know how academic it really is.Otherwise why would it be offered at university? Furthermore, they want more 'academic' subjects such as English Literature to prove their worth but many teenagers find this difficult due to much writing being written in the elaborated code which puts children from a working class background at a disadvantage.

attributes.action: Ban Dustbin lorries from operating between the school-run and rush hours
attributes.background: Dustbin lorries are a major obstruction during school-run and rush hours. it causes chaos and leads to workers and children being late at school/work and should be banned during the hours of 8:30am-9:30am working days
attributes.additional_details: We all know the frustration first thing in the morning when you rushing to work or dropping off your children at school and being stuck 20-30 minutes and then get the telling off! why are you late again? So we are asking throughout this one hour that they should operate only in main roads.

attributes.action: Get the uk goverment to give a larger budget for uk road maintenance
attributes.background: Years of underfunding has left uk roads in a severely poor state, leaving them dangerous in areas

attributes.action: No tolls on Mersey Gateway or Jubilee bridges for Halton residents.
attributes.background: Tolls on local bridges will cost Halton residents £1000 per year and will divide Runcorn and Widnes.
attributes.additional_details: This was reported by BBC North West news on Thursday 26th of January.

attributes.action: Improve category 1 plug in car grants after March 2017 review
attributes.background: Category 1 electric vehicle technology is taking off. These cars can now give around 300 miles in range, matching the average internal combustion engine. These electric cars are becoming more attractive to buyers. In order to help the UK beat and exceed emission targets, ev's must be promoted.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Increase the standard paid length of Paternity Leave in the UK to 4 weeks.
attributes.background:
I have recently completed 2 weeks Paternity Leave after my first child was born. 
It really isn't enough time, the time it takes to properly bond with your child is vastly beyond what is currently allowed. 
It should be totally optional but I believe the government should increase the paid time.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Phase out LED headlights.
attributes.background: LED headlights are a lot brighter than normal headlights and dazzle other drivers, particularly on dark roads (i.e. on country lanes). Please put safety above looks and phase out LED headlights by making them illegal in any future car productions.

attributes.action: Nationalise rail services
attributes.background: The rail services are too expensive and always late, nationalising them would make them accountable to the public and would mean the profits earnt would actually be reinvested in the train services.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2016/may/13/rail-companies-trains-on-time-delays-cancellations-punctuality?client=safari

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/35790137?client=safari

http://www.itv.com/news/meridian/2016-07-19/southern-rail-more-trains-cancelled-and-delayed-despite-emergency-timetable/

attributes.action: Making the Cervical Cancer Vaccination free on the NHS for women 35 and under.
attributes.background: I recently turned 19 years old, and have discovered that  on the NHS I am no longer eligible to be Vaccinated against Cervical Cancer. Cervical Cancer is the most common type of Cancer in Women under 35, and this Vaccination could change that.
attributes.additional_details: Girls to get Vaccinated in schools, but if a girl was to miss this and then circumstances occurred where she never received it prior to being 18, then she will remain unprotected for the rest of her life.

attributes.action: We ask the UK Government to seek to remove Turkey from NATO
attributes.background: Turkey has a consistent record of failing to comply with the necessary Human Rights standards and has very clearly engaged in military actions against essential allies.  Its treatment of the Kurds is a particular example.  Its close relations with Russia render it a security hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is some of the evidence:

https://www.hrw.org/world-report/2017/country-chapters/turkey

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_of_Kurdish_people_in_Turkey

attributes.action: Allow Robert Chilowa to stay in the UK
attributes.background:
- He saved two children from a house fire in Manchester

A man has been told he will be deported from the UK weeks after he saved two children from a house fire in Manchester. Robert Chilowa, who was commended by police for the rescue, said the order felt like a “slap in the face”.
attributes.additional_details:
He ran out of his house barefoot when he heard screams in the early hours of 10 February. A girl who had jumped from the building told him her siblings were still inside. Fighting the heat and smoke, he called up and told the two youngsters to jump and he would catch them.  

His bravery “truly demonstrated community spirit”, police and fire chiefs said, and more lives could have been lost but for his “noble” actions, along with other neighbours.
